title: A knitr engine to simulate interactive sessions
text: R Markdown files combine text code produce, using process called knitting, dynamic documents reports, presentations, websites, even books. Unlike name suggests, R Markdown isn’t just useRs, also Pythonistas, Rubyists, Perl Monks, Lispers, basically everybody enjoys good REPL. ’s just one issue: code chunks written R–since recently Python—evaluated persistent environment; code chucks language evaluated separately. knitractive package solves issue providing knitr engine allows simulate interactive sessions (e.g., Jupyter console, Bash shell, Postgres CLI) across multiple code chunks. Interactive sessions run inside tmux session (optionally via Docker container) tmuxr package. initially developed knitractive along tmuxr rexpect order make book Data Science Command Line available online, way Hadley Wickham Garrett Grolemund’s R Data Science. Now packages open source, hope ’ll enable others create beautiful R Markdown documents favorite programming language REPL.
